entry.title: Tennoji・天王寺
entry.content:
The Tennoji/Abeno area of Osaka, looking northwest from the top of the Abeno Harukas tower, the tallest building in Japan.

The purple tower, center-right, is the Tsutenkaku Tower of the Shinsekai district. The Osaka Tennoji Park and Zoo is the dark area at the bottom. Abiko-Suji is the street along the left side, crossed by the elevated Hanshin Highway 14, lit in orange. The Yodogawa River makes its way across the top of the picture to the Seto Inland Sea (top left) and the city of Kobe.

Below, more photos from Abeno Harukas including Osaka Castle and Shitennoji Temple.

日本一高いビル「あべのハルカス」の頂上から北西を望む、大阪の天王寺・阿倍野エリア。

中央右の紫の塔は、 通天閣です。下は大阪天王寺公園・動物園です。左側はあびこ筋で、オレンジ色に光る阪神高速14号線が横切っている。淀川は写真の上部を横切って、瀬戸内海（左上）、神戸の街へと続いています。

以下、大阪城や四天王寺など、あべのハルカスからの写真を掲載します。

entry.title: Nagaoka Tenmangu・長岡天満宮
entry.content:
Spring in Kyoto, as in many other places around the world, is marked by flowers blooming, one after another. First plum blossoms, then cherry blossoms; followed by azaleas, wisterias, and so on. So that is how we come to Nagaoka Tenmangu shrine, where red kirishima azaleas are in bloom.

京都の春は、花々が次々と咲き誇る季節です。梅、桜、それからつつじ、藤......。そんなわけで、霧島つづじの咲く今日は長岡天満宮にやってきました。

entry.title: Karesansui・枯山水
entry.content:
Morning at Ryoanji Temple, where the maple trees have filled out into a lush green. This is the stone garden (karesansui); a quiet morning for contemplation.

朝の龍安寺の石庭（枯山水）は、もみじの若葉の鮮やかな緑に包まれています。瞑想のための静かな朝。

entry.title: Windows to Another Time・過去への窓

link.title: Windows to Another Time・過去への窓

entry.content:
Looking through teller windows at the Museum of Kyoto Annex. The Annex was originally the Bank of Japan - Kyoto, built in 1906, and these are the windows where customers would make their transactions. It is now an exhibit space, used for the Kyotographie International Photography Festival, going on this month.

京都文化博物館別館で窓越しに見る。別館は1906年に建てられた日本銀行京都支店が前身で、この窓口がお客さんの取引窓口になっていました。現在は展示スペースになっており、今月開催される「Kyotographie 国際写真祭」でも使用されている。

The Annex was originally the Bank of Japan - Kyoto, built in 1906, and these are the windows where customers would make their transactions. entry.title: Omuro Ninnaji・御室仁和寺
entry.content:
The Omuro Zakura Garden at Ninnaji temple. As the cherry blossoms fall to the ground and new leaves sprout, we are reaching the end of sakura season in Kyoto.

仁和寺の御室桜の庭。桜が散り、新緑が芽吹く頃、京都の桜の季節も終わりを告げようとしています。
entry.summary: The Omuro Zakura Garden at Ninnaji temple. As the cherry blossoms fall to the ground and new leaves sprout, we are reaching the end of sakura season in Kyoto.

entry.title: Hikone Castle・彦根城
entry.content:
Hikone Castle in the evening. Located east of Kyoto in Shiga Prefecture, Hikone Castle is one of only 12 original castles in Japan (the others are modern reconstructions).

夜の彦根城。京都の東、滋賀県にある彦根城は、日本に12しかないオリジナルの城の一つです（他は近代的な復元）。
entry.summary: Hikone Castle in the evening. Located east of Kyoto in Shiga Prefecture, Hikone Castle is one of only 12 original castles in Japan (the others are modern reconstructions).
